channel.title: The Hon. Jeb Bush
channel.description: The Hon. Jeb Bush Former Governor, Florida Sean Duffy Frantz Placide (Remarks as Prepared for Delivery)

item.title: (BUSH)
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: Welcome to Florida! Bienvenido a Florida!
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: This election is about the future of this nation. We can shape that future with what we do here, with what we do November 6.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: We can restore America's greatness.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: That starts with a strong economy, a smart energy policy, lower deficits, and a president who puts America's workers and job-creators first.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: But to have a great future - a secure future - a future that is equal to our potential as a nation, we need to do something else.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: We must make sure that our children and grandchildren are ready for the world we are shaping today.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: It starts in our homes, in our communities, and especially in our schools.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: As a candidate and Governor, I visited over 400 schools. I saw children read their first sentences. Solve their first long-division problems. Explore the miracles of chemistry and physics.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: That's the essence of education ­ students getting a chance at a future.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: There are many reasons to believe America's future is bright, but also reasons to worry.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: Of 34 advanced nations in the world, American students rank 17th in science, 25th in math. Only one-fourth of high school graduates are ready for their next steps.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: China and India produce eight times more engineering students each year than the United States.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: There is a moral cost to our failing schools.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: We say that every child in America has an equal opportunity. Tell that to a kid in whose classroom learning isn't respected.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: Tell that to a parent stuck in a school where there is no leadership. Tell that to a young, talented teacher who just got laid off because she didn't have tenure.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: The sad truth is that equality of opportunity doesn't exist in many of our schools. We give some kids a chance, but not all.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: That failure is the great moral and economic issue of our time. And it's hurting all of America.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: I believe we can meet this challenge.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: We need to set high standards for students and teachers and provide students and their parents the choices they deserve.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: The first step is a simple one.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: We must stop pre-judging children based on their race, ethnicity or household income.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: We must stop excusing failure in our schools and start rewarding improvement and success.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: We must have high academic standards that are benchmarked to the best in the world.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: All kids can learn. Governor Romney believes it, and the data proves it. While he was governor, Massachusetts raised standards and today their students lead the nation in academic performance.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: Here in Florida in 1999, we were at the bottom of the nation in education.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: For the last decade, this state has been on a path of reform. Under the leadership of Governor Rick Scott and local leaders, our focus every day is whether students are learning. That's it.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: Today, more students are reading on grade level, passing rigorous college prep courses and graduating from high school.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: And perhaps most exciting, those traditionally left behind are showing the greatest gains.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: Among African-American students, Florida is ranked fourth in the nation for academic improvement. Among low-income students, we're ranked third for our gains.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: Among students with disabilities, we're ranked first.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: And among Latino students, the gains were so big, they required a new metric. Right now, Florida's fourth grade Hispanic students read as well or better than the average of all students in 21 states and the District of Columbia.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: These kids were once written off. But today thanks to teachers like Sean Duffy we're changing that.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: (DUFFY)
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: I'm honored to be an educator, to help the next generation of leaders, thinkers, builders, and entrepreneurs. Sadly, I'm part of a dwindling field.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: I've seen too many good teachers come and go, mainly due to poor working conditions and little pay. Bad teachers get locked into the system and good teachers leave for more money.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: On top of the bureaucratic challenges, what we're teaching doesn't always match what our students need.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: To that end, I launched a STEM lab at my high school. These labs focus on Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics and help students learn proficiency in these fields.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: We turn students away from education each year by not providing a robust curriculum that keeps up with the world in which these students live ­ and will eventually work.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: And at the end of the day, all of what we do from the educators to the policy makers has to be student-focused and student-centered.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: Students matter most.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: (BUSH)
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: Thanks, Sean. I know Del Valle High School is proud of your efforts.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: We need more great teachers like you. Teachers who don't give up on a kid, who recognize that every child can learn, and don't waste a precious year of a student's life.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: If you're a great teacher and your students are mastering their subjects, no matter your age or years of experience, you should have a job.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: Education is hard work, but if you follow some core principles, and you challenge the status quo, you get great results. So here's another thing we can do: Let's give every parent in America a choice about where their child attends school.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: Everywhere in our lives, we get the chance to choose.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: Go down any supermarket aisle - you'll find an incredible selection of milk.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: You can get whole milk, 2% milk, low-fat milk or skim milk. Organic milk, and milk with extra Vitamin D.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: There's flavored milk-- chocolate, strawberry or vanilla ­ and it doesn't even taste like milk.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: They even make milk for people who can't drink milk.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: Shouldn't parents have that kind of choice in schools?
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: Governor Romney gets it. He believes parents ­ regardless of zip code or income ­ should be able to send their child to the school that fits them best.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: That has set him against some entrenched interests.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: There are many people who say they support strong schools but draw the line at school choice.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: "Sorry, kid. Giving you equal opportunity would be too risky. And it will upset powerful political forces that we need to win elections."
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: I have a simple message for these masters of delay and deferral: Choose. You can either help the politically powerful unions. Or you can help the kids.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: Now, I know it's hard to take on the unions. They fund campaigns. They're well-organized. Election day? They'll show up.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: Meanwhile, the kids aren't old enough to vote.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: But you and I know who deserves a choice. Governor Romney knows it, too.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: Let me introduce you to Frantz Placide. Because we gave him a choice, he got a great education.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: (PLACIDE)
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: I grew up in the inner city of Miami. In a place where your zip code determined your chances of success, my only option was an unproductive and failing school.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: I knew that could lead to an unproductive and failing future. Thanks to Governor Bush's school choice program, I got the chance to choose a better school. Making my education my priority, I enrolled at one of the toughest private schools in Miami - Archbishop Curley Notre Dame.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: I'm sure like a lot of us, it was my mother, Carlette, who really pushed for a choice in my education.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: I'm glad she did. Her devotion to my future has given me a chance to succeed. I've graduated from Wagner College, and am looking forward to a life of learning, and serving my community.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: Who knows what the future would have held, if there hadn't been a choice in my education?
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: But I do know the numbers for failure, and I probably wouldn't have had a very good chance. Governor Bush's school choice program gave me the chance to achieve academic success, in the school that was the best fit for me.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: I took it from there.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: (BUSH)
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: Thank you Frantz, it's been an honor to see you grow up. Your story is driving powerful change across this nation. And some of the biggest reformers are Republicans.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: Governor Mitch Daniels in Indiana and Governor Jindal in Louisiana have expanded school choice beyond what we have in Florida.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: Governor Martinez in New Mexico is raising expectations - holding schools accountable for students gaining critical reading skills.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: Governor LePage in Maine and Deal in Georgia are transforming education by pushing schools to harness the power of technology and digital learning.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: Idaho's Governor Otter and Superintendent Luna are raising up the best teachers and separating out the ineffective ones. That earned some enemies. Some of them slashed the superintendent's tires. But he didn't back down.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: Governor Walker in Wisconsin led his state to adopt reforms that promote early literacy and require that teacher evaluations incorporate student achievement.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: In Nevada, Governor Sandoval pushed for reforms to end the damaging practice of "last in, first out" ­ where teachers are hired or fired based on their years in the system, not on their impact in the classroom.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: Governor Haslam in Tennessee is making sure every classroom has an effective teacher. Because he is a former governor, Mitt Romney understands that states must lead this national movement. In Massachusetts, Governor Romney narrowed the gap between students of different races, raised testing standards, and put into place a merit scholarship, the John and Abigail Adams Scholarship that gives students four tuition free years, at any Massachusetts public institution of higher learning.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: He's a champion for bringing hope to education.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: And he intends to be a champion for equality of opportunity, a president who always puts students first.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: So in this election, remember this: Our future as a nation is at stake.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: Fact is, this election is not about just one office. It is about one nation. If we want to continue to be the greatest nation on the planet, we must give our kids what we promise them: An equal opportunity. That starts in the classroom. It starts in our communities. It starts where you live.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: And it starts with electing Mitt Romney the next President of the United States.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush

item.title: Thank you. God bless you, God bless our excellent teachers and God bless the United States of America.
item.author: The Hon. Jeb Bush
